meanings.definition: Relating to the study of the stratigraphic distribution of fossils.
meanings.sent1: The biostratigraphic analysis helped scientists understand the age of the rock layers.
meanings.sent2: The biostratigraphic approach allowed researchers to map out the fossil distribution in the area.
meanings.sent3: The biostratigraphic puzzle was like putting together a giant jigsaw of ancient life.
meanings.sent4: Her mind worked in a biostratigraphic way, organizing memories like layers of fossils.
meanings.sent5: The biostratigraphic patterns in the rocks revealed a timeline of prehistoric events.

meanings.definition: Involving the use of fossils to determine the relative ages of rock layers.
meanings.sent1: The biostratigraphic approach helped geologists date the different rock formations.
meanings.sent2: By analyzing the biostratigraphic data, researchers could establish the sequence of events.
meanings.sent3: The biostratigraphic investigation turned into a fascinating journey through time.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts moved in a biostratigraphic manner, unraveling the layers of history.
meanings.sent5: The biostratigraphic evidence painted a vivid picture of the Earth's past.
